channel.title: Paul Graham Essays
channel.description: Audio versions of Paul Graham's essays
channel.itunes:author: Paul Graham (read by ElevenLabs)

item.title: What to Do
item.description: 1. The importance of taking action over just thinking about ideas. 2. How to identify what's worth doing by looking for things that seem both important and doable. 3. Why the best way to learn what to do is by doing things.

item.title: The Origins of Wokeness
item.description: 1. The historical roots of wokeness in Puritanism and its focus on moral purity. 2. How wokeness has evolved from a positive force for social justice to a form of moral authoritarianism. 3. The dangers of ideological purity and the importance of maintaining intellectual diversity.

item.title: When To Do What You Love
item.description: 1. The importance of timing in pursuing your passions. 2. How to recognize when you're ready to make the leap into doing what you love. 3. Why waiting for the right moment can be more important than rushing into things.

item.title: Writes and Write-Nots
item.description: 1. The difference between good and bad writing habits. 2. How writing is a tool for thinking, not just communication. 3. Why the best writing often comes from rewriting and revision.

item.title: Founder Mode
item.description: 1. The unique mindset required to be a successful founder. 2. How to maintain focus and momentum in the face of challenges. 3. Why the ability to make quick decisions is crucial for startup success.

item.title: How to Start Google
item.description: 1. The importance of starting with a simple, focused idea. 2. How to identify and solve real problems that people care about. 3. Why the best startups often begin as solutions to the founders' own problems.

item.title: The Reddits
item.description: 1. How online communities evolve and maintain their culture. 2. The importance of moderation and community guidelines. 3. Why successful online communities need both structure and freedom.

item.title: The Best Essay
item.description: 1. What makes an essay truly great and memorable. 2. The importance of clarity and originality in writing. 3. How the best essays often challenge conventional wisdom.

item.title: How to Do Great Work
item.description: 1. The importance of working on things you're genuinely interested in. 2. How to maintain focus and avoid distractions. 3. Why persistence and iteration are key to achieving excellence.

item.title: Superlinear Returns
item.description: 1. How small differences in ability can lead to large differences in outcomes. 2. The importance of compounding effects in success. 3. Why focusing on your strengths can lead to exponential growth.

item.title: How to Get New Ideas
item.description: 1. The importance of being curious and asking questions. 2. How to create an environment that fosters creativity. 3. Why the best ideas often come from combining existing concepts in new ways.

item.title: What You (Want To)* Want
item.description: 1. The difference between what you think you want and what you actually want. 2. How to identify your true desires and motivations. 3. Why understanding your real wants is crucial for making good decisions.
